quotetext: There is thought, and then there is thinking about thoughts, and they don't feel the same.
author: Susanna Kaysen

quotetext: Human life is but a series of footnotes to a vast obscure unfinished masterpiece.
author: Vladimir Nabokov

quotetext: He is taller by almost the breadth of my nail, than any of his court, which alone is enough to strike an awe into the beholders.
author: Jonathan Swift

quotetext: Harry — yer a wizard.
author: J.K. Rowling

quotetext: Be careful of love. It'll twist your brain around and leave you thinking up is down and right is wrong.
author: Rick Riordan

quotetext: Do you want me to sing to you? I'll sing all night if it will keep the bad dreams away.
author: Stephenie Meyer

quotetext: It’s a hard thing to leave any deeply routine life, even if you hate it.
author: John Steinbeck

quotetext: You want to remember that while you're judging the book, the book is also judging you.
author: Stephen King

quotetext: Being human totally sucks most of the time.
author: Ernest Cline

quotetext: When I look back on my childhood I wonder how I survived at all.
author: Frank McCourt

quotetext: Even strength must bow to wisdom sometimes.
author: Rick Riordan

quotetext: Do you believe in fairies? Say quick that you believe!
author: J. M. Barrie

quotetext: Everyone who keeps a secret, itches to tell it.
author: Gillian Flynn

quotetext: The good thing about being old, is you don’t have to worry about dying young.
author: Stephen King

quotetext: When the whole world is silent, even one voice becomes powerful.
author: Malala Yousafzai

quotetext: It was beyond comparison, the most beautiful sound he had ever heard.
author: C.S. Lewis

quotetext: Perhaps, somewhere, some day, at a less miserable time, we may see each other again.
author: Vladimir Nabokov

quotetext: Uncertain as I was as I pushed forward, I felt right in my pushing, as if the effort itself meant something.
author: Cheryl Strayed

quotetext: Without pain, how could we know joy? The existence of broccoli does not affect the taste of chocolate.
author: John Green

quotetext: When you've once said a thing, that fixes it, and you must take the consequences.
author: Lewis Carroll

quotetext: His own enjoyment, or his own ease, was, in every particular, his ruling principle.
author: Jane Austen

quotetext: He could not forgive her, but he could not be unfeeling. Though condemning her for the past, and considering it with high and unjust resentment, though perfectly careless of her, and though becoming attached to another, still he could not see her suffer, without the desire of giving her relief. It was a remainder of former sentiment; it was an impulse of pure, though unacknowledged friendship; it was a proof of his own warm and amiable heart, which she could not contemplate without emotions so compounded of pleasure and pain, that she knew not which prevailed.
author: Jane Austen

quotetext: I smiled,—for what had I to fear?
author: Edgar Allan Poe

quotetext: I learned this, at least, by my experiment: that if one advances confidently in the direction of his dreams, and endeavors to live the life which he has imagined, he will meet with a success unexpected in common hours.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quotetext: How many people can make you feel rare and pure and special? How many people can make you feel extraordinary?
author: John Grogan

quotetext: We're all mad here. I'm mad. You're mad.
author: Lewis Carroll

quotetext: I just want to spend every possible minute of the rest of my life with you.
author: Suzanne Collins

quotetext: That's the worst of growing up, and I'm beginning to realize it.
author: L.M. Montgomery

quotetext: Do your thing and don't care if they like it.
author: Tina Fey

quotetext: Anyone who ever gave you confidence, you owe them a lot.
author: Truman Capote

quotetext: See the world as it is, not as you wish it would be
author: E. Lockhart

quotetext: I do not aim with my hand; he who aims with his hand has forgotten the face of his father. I aim with my eye.
author: Stephen King

quotetext: The words I'm sorry felt like an insult.
author: Liane Moriarty

quotetext: Well! I've often seen a cat without a grin, but a grin without a cat! It's the most curious thing I ever saw in my life!
author: Lewis Carroll

quotetext: No, what's troubling is the gap between the magnitude of our challenges and the smallness of our politics.
author: Barack Obama
